definition: to stick up for a wrongdoer
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: The soldiers crept forward under the cover of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 士兵在白昼的回护下向前匍匐。

sentences.english: He built fencing to protect his garden.
sentences.chinese: 他围起了篱笆以回护园子。

sentences.english: We made solid progress in conserving energy, reducing emissions and protecting the environment.
sentences.chinese: 节能减排和环境回护扎实推进。

sentences.english: Are you the legwis guardian of this young man?
sentences.chinese: 你是这男孩儿法律上的回护人吗？

sentences.english: Contains jojoba and olive oil to moisturize and vitamin E to help protect your skin.
sentences.chinese: 包含加州希蒙得木和橄榄油保湿，维生素E回护皮肤。

definition: to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
to make a concession/to be accommodating
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
